actor_awards.box_office_rank: Number one box-office star in the world (1943)

filmography.title: The Gay Divorcee
filmography.role_description: A featured dancer who performs 'Let's K-nock K-nees' with Edward Everett Horton, marking an early standout appearance.
filmography.plot: A woman thinks a flirting man is the co-respondent her lawyer has hired to expedite her divorce.

filmography.title: Follow the Fleet
filmography.role_description: A supporting role as one of the Williams sisters, showcasing her singing and dancing talents alongside Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers.
filmography.plot: Two sailors on shore leave in San Francisco get mixed up with two sisters, one a singer and the other a plain-jane.

filmography.title: Down Argentine Way
filmography.role_description: A wealthy American who falls for an Argentine horse breeder; the role that launched her as a major Technicolor star.
filmography.plot: An American heiress goes to Argentina to buy horses and falls in love with a breeder despite a family feud.

filmography.title: Tin Pan Alley
filmography.role_description: A singer in a sister act who romances a struggling songwriter in this musical drama set in the early 20th century.
filmography.plot: Two songwriters struggle to make it big in the music business while romancing a sister act.

filmography.title: Moon Over Miami
filmography.role_description: A woman who travels to Miami with her sister to hunt for a rich husband, posing as an heiress.
filmography.plot: Two sisters go fortune hunting in Miami, hoping to snag millionaires.

filmography.title: A Yank in the R.A.F.
filmography.role_description: An American chorus girl in London during the Blitz who is pursued by a cocky American pilot.
filmography.plot: An American pilot joins the RAF to be near his former girlfriend, a chorus girl in London during the Blitz.

filmography.title: I Wake Up Screaming
filmography.role_description: The sister of a murdered model who helps the prime suspect clear his name in this early film noir.
filmography.plot: When a model is murdered, her promoter is accused of the crime and must find the real killer with the help of the victim's sister.

filmography.title: Song of the Islands
filmography.role_description: The daughter of an Irish beachcomber in Hawaii who falls for a visiting American.
filmography.plot: An American travels to a Hawaiian island to negotiate a land deal and falls in love with a local girl.

filmography.title: Springtime in the Rockies
filmography.role_description: A Broadway star who heads to a Canadian resort with her former dance partner, sparking romance and jealousy.
filmography.plot: A Broadway couple has a lovers' quarrel, leading the female partner to take up with a Latin dancer.

filmography.title: Coney Island
filmography.role_description: A loud and brassy saloon singer who becomes the center of a rivalry between two club owners.
filmography.plot: Two saloon owners in turn-of-the-century Coney Island compete for the affections of a beautiful singer.

filmography.title: Sweet Rosie O'Grady
filmography.role_description: An American singer who poses as a sophisticated British lady, only to be exposed by a reporter.
filmography.plot: A reporter exposes the past of a musical comedy star who is trying to pass herself off as high society.

filmography.title: Pin Up Girl
filmography.role_description: A USO hostess who poses as a Broadway star to be near a war hero; features her iconic pin-up imagery.
filmography.plot: A humble stenographer travels to Washington D.C. to work as a secretary but ends up posing as a Broadway star.

filmography.title: Diamond Horseshoe
filmography.role_description: A nightclub singer who wants to be a star but gets involved with a medical student instead.
filmography.plot: A singer at Billy Rose's Diamond Horseshoe club agrees to help a medical student, leading to romance.

filmography.title: The Dolly Sisters
filmography.role_description: One half of the famous Hungarian vaudeville sister act who rises to fame in Europe and America.
filmography.plot: A biopic of the Dolly Sisters, two Hungarian entertainers who became stars on Broadway and in Europe.

filmography.title: The Shocking Miss Pilgrim
filmography.role_description: A trailblazing woman in 1874 Boston who becomes the first female typist in a male-dominated office.
filmography.plot: A woman fights for women's suffrage and equal rights in the workplace in late 19th-century Boston.

filmography.title: Mother Wore Tights
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville performer who balances her career on stage with raising two daughters.
filmography.plot: The story of a husband-and-wife vaudeville team and their life together over the years.

filmography.title: That Lady in Ermine
filmography.role_description: A dual role as a countess and her ancestor who steps out of a painting to save her castle from invaders.
filmography.plot: A countess defends her castle from a Hungarian colonel with the help of her ancestor's ghost.

filmography.title: When My Baby Smiles at Me
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville performer who stands by her alcoholic husband as his career declines.
filmography.plot: A vaudeville couple's marriage is tested when the husband's drinking threatens their act and their relationship.

filmography.title: The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
filmography.role_description: A saloon singer with a quick trigger finger who flees to a small town and poses as a schoolteacher.
filmography.plot: A gun-toting saloon singer accidentally shoots a judge and hides out in a small town as a schoolteacher.

filmography.title: Wabash Avenue
filmography.role_description: A shimmy dancer in 1890s Chicago who is caught between a saloon owner and a songwriter.
filmography.plot: A saloon singer becomes a star during the Chicago World's Fair of 1893.

filmography.title: My Blue Heaven
filmography.role_description: A radio star who, along with her husband, tries to adopt a baby while maintaining their show business career.
filmography.plot: A famous radio couple struggles to adopt a child while balancing their career demands.

filmography.title: Call Me Mister
filmography.role_description: An entertainer entertaining troops in Japan who runs into her estranged husband.
filmography.plot: A sergeant tries to win back his wife while they are both stationed in Japan after WWII.

filmography.title: How to Marry a Millionaire
filmography.role_description: A ditzy model who joins two friends in a penthouse scheme to land wealthy husbands, but falls for a forest ranger instead.
filmography.plot: Three women set out to find eligible millionaires to marry, but find true love in the process.

filmography.title: The Farmer Takes a Wife
filmography.role_description: A cook on the Erie Canal who is torn between a canal boat captain and a farmer.
filmography.plot: A farmer works on the Erie Canal to earn money to buy a farm, but falls for a woman who loves the canal life.

filmography.title: How to Be Very, Very Popular
filmography.role_description: A showgirl who witnesses a murder and hides out in a college fraternity house; Grable's final film role.
filmography.plot: Two showgirls witness a murder and hide out at a college, causing chaos on campus.
